summary:
# Daily AI Newsletter Digest - 2/12/2025

## üî• Top Stories
- **Google introduces Gemini 3**: A new, integrated AI model that provides a shared intelligence layer across Google products, offering improved multimodal reasoning and more stable long-context performance.
- **OpenAI's GPT-5.1 Codex Max**: A new coding model that supports long, structured engineering tasks using a method called "compaction" to keep context stable across extended work.
- **Australia bans social media for under-16s**: The country has become the first to ban social media for all users under 16, with platforms required to block new signups and remove existing accounts for minors.

## ü§ñ AI Models & Research
- **xAI launches Grok 4.1**: A dialog model designed to be more controlled and conversational, introducing two operating modes (Thinking and Standard) to balance depth with speed.
- **Aristotle AI solves 30-year-old math problem**: Aristotle, built by Harmonic, has solved a version of Erd≈ës Problem #124 in six hours, marking a significant breakthrough in mathematics.
- **AI model proves Erdos Problem #124**: An AI model has formally verified the proof in Lean in a minute, showcasing progress towards mathematical superintelligence.
- **China overtakes the US in open AI economy**: Chinese companies like DeepSeek and Alibaba's Qwen have captured 14.2% of the market, with true open source models decreasing from 79.3% in 2022 to 39% in 2025.

## üõ†Ô∏è Tools & Products
- **Lyft rebuilds Glow as a unified IoT platform**: Glow is more than an emblem, it represents the beginning of Lyft's unified IoT strategy, addressing the issues of fragmented device management.
- **Optimizely Opal**: An agent orchestration platform built for marketing and digital teams, designed to turn marketing ideals into always-on agents that do the work for users.
- **Databricks raises $5 billion**: Databricks is reportedly in talks to raise $5 billion at a $134 billion valuation, highlighting significant investment in AI and data analytics.
- **HSBC partners with Mistral AI**: The bank will use Mistral's artificial intelligence models to develop generative AI tools for use across the bank.

## üì∞ Industry News
- **OpenAI may deploy ads soon**: A recent update to the ChatGPT Android app includes references to an ‚Äúads feature‚Äù with ‚Äúsearch ads‚Äù and ‚Äúbazaar content‚Äù, suggesting that OpenAI may soon deploy ads.
- **HP plans to lay off 4,000 to 6,000 employees**: The company aims to save $1 billion by the end of its fiscal 2028, favoring AI deployments.
- **Disney develops proprietary AI animation tools**: The tools allow artists to bring sketches to life while retaining their unique art style.
- **Netflix disables phone-to-TV casting**: The feature is now limited to older Chromecast devices and ad-free subscribers.

## üìö Resources & Learning
- **Top 125 AI Tools**: A list of AI tools for various applications, including ChatAgency AI, Whisper Thunder, Atono, Validate Idea, and Klariqo.
- **IBM Network Intelligence**: A solution that combines deep-learning analytics with agentic AI to help businesses evolve beyond point automation.
- **Marqeta's modern payments platform**: A platform that supports the full lifecycle of AI development.
- **Master of Science in Artificial Intelligence**: A degree program for those interested in pursuing a career in AI.

Total Newsletters: 14

newsletters.summary:
## AI Innovations Hub Newsletter

### Key Highlights
- Google introduced Gemini 3, its most integrated AI model yet, which provides a shared intelligence layer across Google products.
- OpenAI released GPT-5.1 Codex Max, a new engine for agentic coding that supports long, structured engineering tasks.
- xAI launched Grok 4.1, a steadier dialog model with clearer reasoning modes.
- Australia became the first country to ban social media for all users under 16.

### Detailed Points
- **Gemini 3**: Google's new AI model is designed for full ecosystem integration, providing improved multimodal reasoning, more stable long-context performance, and clearer grounding. It is now available across Google products, including Search, Workspace, and the Gemini app.
- **GPT-5.1 Codex Max**: OpenAI's new coding model is built for agentic development and supports long, structured engineering tasks. It uses a method called "compaction" to keep context stable across extended work and is now the default engine in OpenAI's updated coding tools.
- **Grok 4.1**: xAI's new dialog model is designed to be more controlled and conversational. It introduces two operating modes, Thinking and Standard, to balance depth with speed, and uses updated training to reduce hallucinations and improve context handling.
- **Australia's Social Media Ban**: The country has banned all children under 16 from having social media accounts, with platforms required to block new under-16 signups and remove existing accounts for minors. The rule covers major social media platforms, including TikTok, Instagram, Facebook, Snapchat, X, and YouTube.
- **AI Tools and Resources**: The newsletter highlights several AI tools and resources, including Refresh Me, Glambase, IdeaApe, Rork, and Lovable. It also provides links to free resources, such as the GPT-5 Prompting Guide, OpenAI's AI Academy, and Google Cloud's AI Training.
- **HubSpot's Guide to AI**: The newsletter mentions HubSpot's guide to AI, which provides tips on how to use AI for automation, decision-making, and innovation.
- **Microsoft's AI & Tech Courses**: The newsletter highlights Microsoft's AI and tech courses, which cover topics such as AI, machine learning, and cloud tools.
- **NVIDIA's AI Courses**: The newsletter mentions NVIDIA's AI courses, which cover topics such as deep learning and accelerated computing.
- **Quick Reads**: The newsletter provides links to several quick reads, including articles on AI-assisted shopping, NYC nurses claiming hospitals are using AI to threaten jobs, and a quiz on how to spot AI-generated videos.

newsletters.subject: How Lyft Rebuilt its Iconic Dashboard Emblem and its entire IoT Platform along with it?
newsletters.summary:
## Hello, World!

### Key Highlights
- Lyft rebuilt its iconic dashboard emblem, Glow, as a unified IoT platform with secure provisioning, real-time control, device shadowing, and safe OTA updates.
- The new platform addresses the issues of fragmented device management and lays the foundation for future IoT developments.
- Glow is more than an emblem, it represents the beginning of Lyft's unified IoT strategy.

### Detailed Points
- Lyft's ride-sharing platform connects millions of riders and drivers, and its IoT ecosystem includes hardware-powered services such as bikes, scooters, in-car devices, digital advertising screens, and autonomous vehicle research platforms.
- The company needed a unified, modern, and secure IoT platform to manage its growing hardware footprint.
- Glow's provisioning system was redesigned to use a unique serial number for each device, stored in its internal flash memory and printed as a barcode, to eliminate the reliance on MAC addresses.
- The device uses Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to pair with the driver's phone, which acts as an IoT gateway to forward commands and receive responses.
- Glow's command framework includes passthrough commands for simple tasks and complex commands for larger operations, allowing for flexibility and extensibility.
- The device sends telemetry data, including sensor readings, diagnostic information, warning messages, and heartbeat messages, to the mobile app, which forwards them to Lyft's backend.
- The company uses a Device Shadow to manage the state of each Glow device, ensuring that the device is always up-to-date and in sync.
- Glow's firmware updates are designed to be resilient to failure, with a dual-bank storage system and a recovery firmware to prevent bricking.
- The platform provides lessons for IoT development, including the importance of identity, unified platforms, and security.

newsletters.summary:
## The AI Prompting Playbook

### Key Highlights
- ChatGPT turns 3 with 800 million weekly users.
- Anthropic releases an official guide for prompting AI models.
- Avatar director James Cameron criticizes generative AI.
- Experts predict significant changes in the tech industry for 2026.
- A new AI tool is developed to help take on cancer mysteries.

### Detailed Points
- ChatGPT, a popular AI tool, has reached its third anniversary with an impressive 800 million weekly users, demonstrating its widespread adoption and growth.
- Anthropic has published a comprehensive guide on how to effectively prompt their AI models, including Sonnet 4.5, Haiku 4.5, and Opus 4.5, to get the best results.
- James Cameron, the director of Avatar, has expressed concerns about the impact of generative AI on the film industry, stating that it threatens the collaboration between actors and directors.
- Experts predict that 2026 will bring significant changes in the tech industry, including the need for a new kind of software builder who blends art, science, and AI fluency.
- A new AI-powered microscopy tool has been developed to help scientists detect the mutations behind cancer's earliest stages, potentially leading to new treatments and therapies.
- Kubota has developed a driverless tractor powered by hydrogen and AI, which can farm on its own using GPS and sensors.
- Intangible is a new AI tool that allows users to create detailed 3D worlds from text prompts, with applications in film, games, marketing, and events.
- Guidde is an AI-powered tool that helps teams explain complex tasks in seconds with AI-generated documentation, making it easier to delegate work and save time.
- Various AI tools and platforms have been highlighted, including Sweep, Cool Coloring Pages, MagicTrips, Limitless, Sparkle, PhoneCaseAI, and PodScribe.IO, each offering unique features and applications.
- There's An AI For That has also released a collection of merchandise, including hoodies, hats, tees, sweatshirts, and mugs, for those who want to show their support for AI.

newsletters.summary:
## The Tech Buzz

### Key Highlights
- Nvidia denies Burry fraud claim, Alphabet reaches $4T valuation, and Bezos' Project Prometheus makes significant moves in the tech industry
- Large funding rounds: X-energy ($700M), Physical Intelligence ($600M Series B), and Harmonic ($120M)
- Companies making waves: Revolut, Public AI-powered brokerage, Clover Security, Joby Aviation, CleanSpark, and Pony.ai
- Open deals: Startups raising capital, including Wyoming Decentralized Exchange and DUNA SNAP Funding

### Detailed Points
- **Big Movers**: Nvidia issued a memo denying accounting fraud allegations, Alphabet's valuation nearing $4T, and Bezos' Project Prometheus acquiring General Agents for $6.2B
- **Large Rounds**: X-energy closed a $700M oversubscribed Series D, Physical Intelligence raised $600M in a Series B round, and Harmonic raised $120M
- **Companies Making Waves**: Revolut completed a secondary share sale, increasing its valuation by 66% to $75B, Public launched an AI-powered brokerage, Clover Security raised $36M for AI-driven security, and Joby Aviation developed an autonomous hybrid S4 VTOL aircraft
- **Open Deals**: Wyoming Decentralized Exchange (WYDE Cause Coins) and DUNA SNAP Funding are raising capital
- **Exit Watching**: Revolut completed a secondary share sale, Paxos acquired Fordefi, and Kraken confidentially filed for an IPO
- **The Funding Buzz**: Bitfury launched a $1B emerging tech fund, Firgun Ventures raised a $250M VC fund, and Baobab Ventures raised $15M to invest in quantum technology companies
- **Team Up**: Partnerships and collaborations, including Pony.ai and Toyota, GMI Cloud and Nvidia, and Ford and Amazon
- **New Products and Tools**: Delve launched an AI browser agent, and X-energy is developing an advanced SMR nuclear technology

newsletters.summary:
## The Rundown AI

### Key Highlights
- An AI system called Aristotle has solved a 30-year-old math problem, marking a significant breakthrough in the field of mathematics.
- The Rundown Roundtable is a new feature showcasing how readers use AI in their work and daily lives.
- China has overtaken the U.S. in the open AI economy, with Chinese companies like DeepSeek and Alibaba's Qwen leading the way.
- Warp's Development Agent has been upgraded, allowing for full terminal use, steerable planning, and full lifecycle support.

### Detailed Points
- Aristotle, built by Harmonic, solved a version of Erd≈ës Problem #124 in six hours, and then formally verified the proof in Lean in a minute. This breakthrough is considered the first real step into the "vibe proving" era of mathematics.
- The Rundown Roundtable features readers' AI use cases, including using AI for fitness goals, health management, and workflow optimization.
- China's rise in the open AI economy is driven by companies like DeepSeek and Qwen, which have captured 14.2% of the market. The study found that true open source is dying, with models disclosing their training data decreasing from 79.3% in 2022 to 39% in 2025.
- Warp's Development Agent update includes features like full terminal use, steerable planning, and full lifecycle support, making it a powerful tool for developers.
- Other notable updates include the launch of Cocoon, a decentralized compute network, and the introduction of Nano Banana Pro for Slide Decks.
- The newsletter also mentions various tools and technologies, including Math V2, Perplexity, GELab-Zero-4B, and Vidi2.

newsletters.summary:
## TLDR

### Key Highlights
- OpenAI is internally testing ads inside ChatGPT, with the feature initially limited to the search experience.
- Tesla has introduced a "Tesla Ride" program, offering supervised Full Self-Driving demos and Grok AI-guided experiences.
- HP plans to lay off 4,000 to 6,000 employees in favor of AI deployments, aiming to save $1 billion by the end of its fiscal 2028.
- Researchers have discovered a way to keep HIV under control long-term without constant treatment, using broadly neutralizing antibodies.

### Detailed Points
- OpenAI's ChatGPT Android app beta includes references to an ads feature, which could disrupt the web economy with its 800 million weekly users.
- The Tesla Ride program allows participants to experience FSD and Grok AI in real-world demos, with sessions capped at 45 minutes and requiring a valid driver's license and insurance.
- Meticulous, a company founded by ex-Palantir engineers, offers an AI-native testing service that autonomously creates E2E UI tests with near-exhaustive coverage and zero maintenance.
- QA Wolf, another AI-native service, allows companies to pay for test coverage rather than labor hours, delivering 5x faster tests and 80% coverage in less than 4 months.
- Researchers have made progress in achieving lasting remission for HIV, with two independent trials showing promise in using broadly neutralizing antibodies to neutralize the virus.
- Disney has developed proprietary AI animation tools that allow artists to bring sketches to life while retaining their unique art style.
- HP's layoffs are part of a broader trend of companies adopting AI to accelerate product innovation, improve customer satisfaction, and boost productivity.

### Important Links

## AI Automation Society Newsletter

### Key Highlights
- A Q&A session with Nate is scheduled for Tuesday, December 2nd, at 4:30am - 5:00am Calcutta time.
- The event is exclusive to plus members, but recordings will be available.
- The AI Automation Society is encouraging subscribers to become plus members to unlock weekly calls with Nate.

### Detailed Points
- The Q&A session with Nate is a significant event for plus members, providing an opportunity for direct interaction and insights.
- To access the event, members need to be part of the plus membership program, which offers weekly calls with Nate among other benefits.
- The session is scheduled for a specific time frame, and it's crucial for interested members to adjust their schedules accordingly to participate live.
- For those who cannot attend the live session, recordings will be made available, ensuring that plus members can access the content at their convenience.
- The newsletter also provides options for subscribers to manage their event notifications, including the ability to unsubscribe from event notifications or view the calendar for upcoming events.
- Additionally, there's an invitation to start one's own Skool, suggesting a platform or community aspect to the AI Automation Society where members can create their own groups or content.

newsletters.subject: Harmonizing the past: EEG-based brain network unveil modality-specific mechanisms of nostalgia
newsletters.summary:
## JournalClub.io Newsletter

### Key Highlights
- Researchers from Southwest University in China have conducted a study to understand how nostalgia works at the neural level, using EEG-based brain network analysis to unveil modality-specific mechanisms of nostalgia.
- The study found that nostalgic stimuli elicited significantly stronger functional connectivity in the alpha and gamma bands, indicating improved information integration and more efficient neural communication during nostalgic processing.
- The research suggests that nostalgia acts as a neural integrator that strengthens communication across emotional and mnemonic networks, heightens reward-related activity, and optimizes cognitive efficiency.

### Detailed Points
- The study used a within-subjects design, where each participant experienced all conditions, and exposed participants to both nostalgic and non-nostalgic stimuli through three different channels: music, images/lyrics, and audiovisual combinations.
- The researchers monitored brain activity using EEG and collected data about emotional responses, including state nostalgia and emotional responses across multiple dimensions.
- The study used a passive listening paradigm, where participants were not asked to perform any particular task beyond experiencing the stimuli and reporting their responses.
- The researchers used a variety of tools and techniques, including EEG, Independent Component Analysis (ICA), and Weighted Phase Lag Index (WPLI) to analyze the data.
- The study found that auditory nostalgia was more potent than visual, while audiovisual combinations produced the strongest overall nostalgic experience, suggesting that multisensory convergence enhances emotional depth.
- The research also found that nostalgia enhances both distributed and localized synchronization of neural activity, facilitating the coordination of memory, emotion, and self-referential processing.
- The study's findings have implications for our understanding of nostalgia as a neural integrator that can evoke comfort, identity coherence, and emotional resilience.

### Important Links
- **Watch or Listen to the Episode**: [https://journalclub.io/episodes/harmonizing-the-past-eeg-based-brain-network-unveil-modality-specific-mechanisms-of-nostalgia?token=skSTNPVHwEzC5VihjGCE25FBjF9iJ1rLGKpW42qAe821c5JWvF](https://journalclub.io/episodes/harmonizing-the-past-eeg-based-brain-network-unveil-modality-specific-mechanisms-of-nostalgia?token=skSTNPVHwEzC5VihjGCE25FBjF9iJ1rLGKpW42qAe821c5JWvF) - This link allows readers to access the full episode and learn more about the study.

newsletters.originalContent:
Harmonizing the past: EEG-based brain network unveil modality-specific mechanisms of nostalgia   

You‚Äôre at a bar with your friends, having a few drinks. There‚Äôs a DJ in the corner going through the Top 40. Not terrible, but not great, so you‚Äôre not paying much attention to the music. Then, all of a sudden they put on that song. That song from childhood, or from middle school or from high school. The song that you can remember hearing and singing along with for the first time all those years ago. The song that takes you right back to that time and place. You and your friends jump off the bar stools and hit the dance floor. The party is on.

![](https://journalclub.io/px/tIHOjrlv4KvNpqLhFwBzfmDPS8q71BvhjOa2uh3VQsKHOVB82P)

Harmonizing the past: EEG-based brain network unveil modality-specific mechanisms of nostalgia

JournalClub.io, December 1st 2025  
  

[![Thumbnail of today's episode.](https://cdn.filestackcontent.com/w3NqmeFS76GkaRbhbm5g)](https://journalclub.io/episodes/harmonizi

## Superhuman Newsletter

### Key Highlights
- AI-driven eCommerce traffic jumped 805% on Black Friday, contributing to a record $11.8 billion in sales.
- Gemini app downloads are catching up to ChatGPT, with 64 million downloads in October.
- HSBC estimates OpenAI will not be cash flow positive before 2030 and needs $207 billion to meet growth plans.
- Warner Music Group partnered with Suno, an AI music platform, to empower the creative community and open new revenue opportunities.

### Detailed Points
- AI traffic converted at a higher rate than traditional browsing in October, with a 16% better conversion rate.
- ChatGPT remains the most popular AI chatbot with 85 million monthly downloads in October.
- Gemini users spend more time chatting than ChatGPT or Claude users.
- The trend is driven by Gemini's enhanced image generation capabilities.
- Adobe found that AI-driven traffic to US retail websites jumped 805% compared to last year.
- The partnership between Warner Music Group and Suno aims to create new revenue opportunities for artists and empower the creative community.
- Suno's users generate an entire Spotify catalog's worth of music every two weeks, producing real hits with at least six AI artists debuting on Billboard charts.
- HSBC's analysis projects that OpenAI will need another $207 billion to meet its growth plans, which include $1.4 trillion in compute commitments.
- IBM announced Network Intelligence, a solution that combines deep-learning analytics with agentic AI to help businesses evolve beyond point automation.
- The newsletter also featured various AI tools, including ChatAgency AI, Whisper Thunder, Atono, Validate Idea, and Klariqo.
- A prompt was provided to optimize a resume with AI, and a utopian city was generated using Midjourney.

## AI Automation Society Newsletter

### Key Highlights
- The AI Automation Society has announced its November MVPs, recognizing the top 5 members who have made significant contributions to the community.
- The society is sending bundled email notifications, and subscribers can adjust their notification settings to receive updates at their preferred frequency.
- The newsletter provides an update on the community's activity and encourages subscribers to engage with the content.

### Detailed Points
- The November MVPs are:
  1. @Muskan Ahlawat
  2. @Kevin troy Lumandas
  3. @Frank van Bokhorst
  4. @Christian Rivadeneira
  5. @Noel Doe
- Nate Herk posted an announcement about the November MVPs, congratulating them on their achievements and encouraging others to follow their example.
- The AI Automation Society is using a bundled email notification system, which sends updates at a frequency of 1 hour by default.
- Subscribers can adjust their notification settings to receive updates at frequencies of 5 minutes, 3 hours, 6 hours, 12 hours, daily, 48 hours, or weekly.
- The society invites subscribers to start their own Skool, providing a link to do so.
- The newsletter includes links to change notification settings, view the group, and start a new Skool.

### Important Links
- **Change notification settings**: [https://link.skool.com/ls/click?upn=u001.wK6x93jhdVos-2F3TofGJCJqYIach7-2FtMhH3n-2Fh9qG9l1PI-2Fm-2BraVkdOOdLOhb-2F-2B9kC6CS8L3GE-2B2twtfU-2FANqqw-3D-3DCDFu_dhmFokmJdYhJ7cOq2uAxQbs-2FJ9rdv-2B8XUdt4bEaaXnETGAW5pCoxqmB9U4HcUgw2jEsWClLRMUYZZ8KYTITMXLOrpV0hqE8L1laGT5-2BMgR4P6adUW8BWV7z-2F5K8L5KLw-2BQ9a0Honnh9pmPEvLJRtOZauhsHjOnyPMLWGE09cpynoBU1K2ugeuGTl1xh-2FkXBspFAlrt6gq-2FhDduaTJ6NEX4gKnQRZroNDZ5UDlGOXwYe8gs3rIpagxbtHRaZqqhxWfYFKnRBnffblg3dj4wrSsuEPDkNAjuJy9k0ZblhDnKicHl8hUArOie5PppBRvSJ-2Bff9KfJ3CnA1iyj3o-2Bxm5Bong-2FYYWS9DPLmbYgJ6dZqKsYgWhQnr4Tpiv3g57U0xAQ-2FCi7FNKIuORjze-2Fj8OiQGiv0N2ChUhi5E1ILbzMI0sLnnIFmv8xRzYkytFAY5fPSrhzIWcKwB8qy5GBZCWAD2NvU2vK6q6ZcowhSvE931n6fKpkp7ZGtq-2BSx9UKCotXnZ2dCgLNV8MHhhDYrtjtdw-3D-3D](https://link.skool.com/ls/click?upn=u001.wK6x93jhdVos-2F3TofGJCJqYIach7-2FtMhH3n-2Fh9qG9l1PI-2Fm-2BraVkdOOdLOhb-2F-2B9kC6CS8L3GE-2B2twtfU-2FANqqw-3D-3DCDFu_dhmFokmJdYhJ7cOq2uAxQbs-2FJ9rdv-2B8XUdt4bEaaXnETGAW5pCoxqmB9U4HcUgw2jEsWClLRMUYZZ8KYTITMXLOrpV0hqE8L1laGT5-2BMgR4P6adUW8BWV7z-2F5K8L5KLw-2BQ9a0Honnh9pmPEvLJRtOZauhsHjOnyPMLWGE09cpynoBU1K2ugeuGTl1xh-2FkXBspFAlrt6gq-2FhDduaTJ6NEX4gKnQRZroNDZ5UDlGOXwYe8gs3rIpagxbtHRaZqqhxWfYFKnRBnffblg3dj4wrSsuEPDkNAjuJy9k0ZblhDnKicHl8hUArOie5PppBRvSJ-2Bff9KfJ3CnA1iyj3o-2Bxm5Bong-2FYYWS9DPLmbYgJ6dZqKsYgWhQnr4Tpiv3g57U0xAQ-2FCi7FNKIuORjze-2Fj8OiQGiv0N2ChUhi5E1ILbzMI0sLnnIFmv8xRzYkytFAY5fPSrhzIWcKwB8qy5GBZCWAD2NvU2vK6q6ZcowhSvE931n6fKpkp7ZGtq-2BSx9UKCotXnZ2dCgLNV8MHhhDYrtjtdw-3D-3D) : Allows subscribers to adjust their notification settings.

newsletters.summary:
## TLDR AI

### Key Highlights
- OpenAI may deploy ads soon, as indicated by a recent update to the ChatGPT Android app.
- Optimizely Opal is an agent orchestration platform built for marketing and digital teams, designed to turn marketing ideals into always-on agents that do the work for users.
- A recent achievement in AI includes an AI model proving Erdos Problem #124 in Lean by itself, showcasing progress towards mathematical superintelligence.
- Databricks is reportedly in talks to raise $5 billion at a $134 billion valuation, highlighting significant investment in AI and data analytics.

### Detailed Points
- **OpenAI Updates**: A recent update to the ChatGPT Android app included references to an ‚Äúads feature‚Äù with ‚Äúsearch ads‚Äù and ‚Äúbazaar content‚Äù, suggesting that OpenAI may soon deploy ads.
- **Optimizely Opal**: Optimizely Opal is an AI system expressly designed for marketing teams, focusing on real marketing pain points, repetitive workflows, and tasks that kill momentum and creativity. It turns marketing ideals into always-on agents that do the work for users, making it different from generic AI tools.
- **AI Achievements**: An AI model has proven Erdos Problem #124 in Lean by itself, a problem that has been open for nearly 30 years. This achievement shows how mathematical superintelligence is getting closer and will change and dramatically accelerate progress in mathematics and all dependent fields.
- **Databricks**: Databricks is reportedly in talks to raise $5 billion at a $134 billion valuation. The company has resisted pressure to go public, but an IPO would likely be well-received. Databricks has more than 20,000 customers, including OpenAI, Block, Shell, and Toyota, and its platform offers tools that support the full lifecycle of AI development.
- **Prompt Caching**: Prompt caching works per-content, not per-conversation, and prefix caching works at the token level, not the request level, allowing it to work across requests. Any change in the prefix breaks the entire hash chain.
- **Context Plumbing**: Context is always changing and dynamic, and to make an agent run well, engineers need to move the context to where it needs to be. Agents shouldn‚Äôt have to look up context for every single query because that‚Äôs slow. Engineers need to build pipes that continuously flow potential context from where it is created to where it is going to be used.
- **Embodied Cognition Benchmarking**: ENACT is a benchmark for evaluating embodied cognition using egocentric world modeling.
- **AI Adoption**: AI adoption rates are starting to flatten out across all firm sizes, according to a post containing charts on the topic.
- **The Thinking Game**: A documentary covering the pivotal moments over five years at DeepMind, an AI company founded by Demis Hassabis, is available.
- **Job Opportunities**: There are job openings at TLDR, and referrals can earn rewards. The company is also looking for people to advertise with them.

### Important Links

newsletters.subject: Leak Shows Personalized Ads Are Coming To ChatGPT
newsletters.summary:
## AI Breakfast

### Key Highlights
- Leak shows personalized ads are coming to ChatGPT, leveraging conversation history, prompts, and user behavior for tailored advertising.
- Google DeepMind's AlphaFold is moving to the next phase, combining atomic precision with AI reasoning for enhanced protein predictions.
- A leak in the ChatGPT Android beta reveals features like a "search ads carousel" and "bazaar content," similar to Google Search.

### Detailed Points
- **Google DeepMind‚Äôs AlphaFold**: The next leap in AlphaFold's development involves marrying atomic precision with AI reasoning, enabling the system to read scientific papers, generate mechanistic hypotheses, and iteratively test them with high-fidelity molecular predictions. This could significantly impact fields like biology and drug discovery.
  
- **OpenAI Leaks and ChatGPT Ads**: Leaked references in the ChatGPT Android beta indicate the introduction of personalized ads, using a "search ads carousel" and "bazaar content" similar to Google Search. This shift could substantially increase revenue potential for OpenAI, given ChatGPT's large user base.
- **Crisis-Response Audit**: A recent audit of 25 chatbots using subtle self-harm prompts found that only Google‚Äôs Gemini 3 Pro consistently avoided harmful replies, highlighting the disparity in crisis-response reliability among chatbot systems.
- **AI Job Displacement**: Fears of AI job displacement have doubled in just 12 months, according to a KPMG study, as AI's role in automation and job markets becomes more pronounced.
- **New AI Tools and Developments**: Various new tools and technologies are emerging, including TinyCommand for no-code automation, Ripplica for automating browser workflows, Agenta for open-source LLMOps, Unfold for interactive AI-powered courses, and Velt for collaboration SDKs with real-time multiplayer features.
- **AI Research Papers**: Recent research papers on arXiv cover topics like "The Image as Its Own Reward: Reinforcement Learning with Adversarial Reward for Image Generation," "Structured Prompting Enables More Robust, Holistic Evaluation of Language Models," and "Video Generation Models Are Good Latent Reward Models."

newsletters.subject: You can make AI do bad things by using poetry
newsletters.summary:
## Mindstream Newsletter

### Key Highlights
- Researchers have discovered that poetry can be used to trick AI models into producing harmful responses, with 62% of tested responses being unsafe across 25 models.
- HSBC has partnered with French AI start-up Mistral to use its artificial intelligence models, marking a significant shift in the banking sector's adoption of AI.
- Netflix has quietly disabled phone-to-TV casting for most users, limiting the feature to older Chromecast devices and ad-free subscribers.

### Detailed Points
- A study by Italy's Icaro Lab found that poetry's unpredictable nature makes it difficult for AI models to detect harmful intent, with poetic structure making harmful prompts harder for AI to detect.
- The study tested 25 AI models from nine companies, including OpenAI, Google, and Meta, with OpenAI's GPT-5 nano avoiding all harmful outputs and Google's Gemini 2.5 Pro responding with unsafe content to every poem tested.
- HSBC's partnership with Mistral aims to develop generative AI tools for use across the bank, supporting tasks such as financial analysis, document review, and translation.
- The banking sector is increasingly adopting AI to improve productivity and reduce costs, with JPMorgan Chase rolling out an internal AI tool to help employees draft performance reviews.
- Mindstream has featured several tools, including BookBud.ai, an AI-powered self-publishing platform, Cool Coloring Pages, an AI coloring-page generator, Prompt Genie, a prompt-enhancing tool, and Lasso, an AI-powered content moderation platform.
- The newsletter also covered other topics, such as the detection of a potential primordial black hole, Virgin Media's fine for leaving vulnerable customers without working lifesaving telecare alarms, and Leona Lewis's song "One More Sleep" becoming the most streamed British Christmas song of the 21st century.

newsletters.subject: LAST CHANCE! Half Off Your Better Alternative to Zillow
newsletters.summary:
## The Tech Buzz

### Key Highlights
- The Tech Buzz is offering a Black Friday deal with 50% off on exclusive, intent-based leads in a specific area, with the option to buy both WebHawk and Real Intent or just one of them at a discounted price.
- The offer is only available until tomorrow, and zip codes are exclusive, with only one agent or broker per zip code.
- Real Intent helps real estate professionals leverage advanced technologies to identify motivated sellers and buyers using intent data.
- A webinar is available to learn more about Real Intent and how to leverage intent data in real estate businesses.

### Detailed Points
- The Black Friday deal offers 50% off on exclusive, intent-based leads, with two options: buying both WebHawk and Real Intent for 50% off, or buying just one of them for 30% off.
- The exclusive leads are based on consumer online intent data, which helps identify motivated sellers and buyers at the optimal time.
- Real Intent's solution is up to 90% more affordable than Zillow's Premier Agent service.
- The company is currently working with only one broker or agent per zip code, making the leads exclusive to that agent or broker.
- Some agents have seen significant success with Real Intent, including one agent who increased seller meetings by two-fold and listed two properties in the first month, and another agent who got a listing in their free trial week.
- The webinar will cover what consumer online intent data is, how it helps identify motivated sellers and buyers, and how Real Intent's solution works.
- The webinar will also provide real-world examples of agents successfully leveraging intent data in their businesses.
- Real Intent is currently only working with small-sized companies, providing them with advanced technologies typically only available to large enterprises.
- The company is offering a free trial week, and some agents have seen success during this period.
